g.text: 8. Richter, F., Chaussidon, M., Mendybaev, R. & Edwin, K. Reassessing the cooling rate and geologic setting of Martian meteorites MIL
9. Schaber, G. G., Horstman, K. C. & Dial, A. L. Jr. Lava flow materials in the Tharsis region of Mars.
10. Yoshioka, M. J. T. Volcano and lava flow morphology of Elysium Mons. Mars and implications for eruption character. Univ. Hawaii
11. Mouginis‐Mark, P. & Yoshioka, M. T. The long lava flows of Elysium Planita, Mars.
. Oceans in the past history of Mars: Tests for their presence using Mars Orbiter Laser Altimeter (MOLA) data.
13. Glaze, L. S., Baloga, S. M. & Stofan, E. R. A methodology for constraining lava flow rheologies with MOLA.
14. Treiman, A. H. The nakhlite meteorites: Augite-rich igneous rocks from Mars
15. Hammer, J. E. Application of a textural geospeedometer to the late-stage magmatic history of MIL 03346.
16. Domeneghetti, M. C., Fioretti, A., Cámara, F., McCammon, C. & Alvaro, M. Thermal history of nakhlites: A comparison between
MIL 03346 and its terrestrial analogue Theo’s Flow.
17. Griffiths, R. W. Fink, J. H. Solidification and morphology of submarine lavas: A dependence on extrusion rate.
18. Gregg, T. K. Deep-sea eruptions. in
Modeling Volcanic Processes: The Physics and Mathematics of
Gregg, T. K. P. & Lopes R. M. C.) 258–274 (Cambridge University Press New York, 2013).
19. Fink, J. H. & Griffiths, R. W. Radial spreading of viscous-gravity currents with solidifying crust.
. Morphology and dynamics of inflated subaqueous basaltic lava flows.
21. Gregg, T. K. P. & Fornari, D. J. Long submarine lava flows: Observations and results from numerical modeling.
22. Ganguly, J. Mg-Fe order-disorder in ferromagnesian silicates: II. Thermodynamics, kinetics, and geological applications. In
23. Murri, M., Cámara, F., Adam, J., Domeneghetti, M. C. & Alvaro, M. Intracrystalline “geothermometry” assessed on clino and
. The role of Fe content on the Fe-Mg exchange reaction in augite.
25. McCallister, R. H., Finger, L. W. & Ohashi, Y. Intracrystalline Fe (super 2
) -Mg equilibria in three natural Ca-rich clinopyroxenes.
26. Dal Negro, A., Carbonin, S., Molin, G. M., Cundari, A. & Piccirillo, E. M. Intracrystalline cation distribution in natural
clinopyroxenes of tholeiitic, transitional, and alkaline basaltic rocks. In
27. Ghose, S. & Ganguly, J. Mg-Fe order-disorder in ferromagnesian silicates. In
28. Molin, G. & Zanazzi, P. F. Intracrystalline Fe
-Mg ordering in augite: experimental study and geothermometric applications.
29. Brizi, E., Molin, G. & Zanazzi, P. F. Experimental study of intracrystalline Fe
-Mg exchange in three augite crystals: Effect of
30. Alvaro, M., Cámara, F., Domeneghetti, M., Nestola, F. & Tazzoli, V. HT P21/c–C2/c phase transition and kinetics of Fe
order–disorder of an Fe-poor pigeonite: implications for the cooling history of ureilites.
. Viscosity of pyroxenite melt and its evolution during cooling.
. Emplacement of the youngest flood lava on Mars: A short, turbulent story.
33. Hurwitz, D. M., Fassett, C. I., Head, J. W. & Wilson, L. Formation of an eroded lava channel within an Elysium Planitia impact crater:
Distinguishing between a mechanical and thermal origin.
34. Udry, A. & Day, J. M. D. 1.34 billion-year-old magmatism on Mars evaluated from the co-genetic nakhlite and chassignite meteorites.
35. Angel, R. J. & Nestola, F. A century of mineral structures: How well do we know them?
. Reclassification and thermal history of Trenzano chondrite.
37. Papike, J. J. Pyroxenes and Amphiboles: crystal chemistry and phase petrology
Mineralogical Society of America 2, Special Paper N.2
38. Droop, G. A general equation for estimating Fe
concentrations in ferromagnesian silicates and oxides from microprobe analyses,
39. Sheldrick, G. M. A short history of SHELX.
40. Rossi, G., Oberti, R., Dal Negro, A., Molin, G. M. & Mellini, M. Residual electron density at the M2 site in
clinopyroxenes:Relationships with bulk chemistry and sub-solidus evolution.
41. Ibers, J. A. & Hamilton, W. C. International tables for X-ray crystallography.
42. Hawthorne, F. C., Ungaretti, L. & Oberti, R. Site populations in minerals; terminology and presentation of results of crystal-structure
44. Nestola, F., Boffa Ballaran, T., Liebske, C., Thompson, R. & Downs, R. T. The effect of the hedenbergitic substitution on the
M.M. and M.A. have been funded by the IMPACt project (R164WEJAHH) to M. Alvaro and by the European
Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme
(grant agreement 714936) for the project TRUE DEPTHS to M. Alvaro. M.C.D. has been funded by the IMPACt
project (R164WEJAHH) to M. Alvaro and by the PNRA 2016 grant to L. Folco. M.M., M.A. and M.C.D. are
also supported by TOMOX project to L. Marinangeli. We thank Allan Treiman for kindly supplying Theo’s Flow
samples. D.P. has been funded by the European Research Council Consolidator Grant ERC-2013-COG No.
612776 (CHRONOS project) to D. Perugini. The Alexander von Humboldt foundation senior research grant to F.
Vetere is also acknowledged. M.A. is also supported by the Ministero dell’Istruzione dell’Università e della Ricerca
(MIUR)Progetti di Ricerca di Interesse Nazionale (PRIN)Bando PRIN 2017 - Prot. 2017ZE49E7_005. M.M and
M.C.D acknowledge financial contribution from the agreement ASI-INAF n.2018-16-HH.0.
